explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Classified in UNRTDG Class: 6.1, Subsidiary risks Class: 3

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures, which in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing oxygen (but not chlorine and fluorine) chemically bonded only to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements).

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: SPECIES: Rat ENDPOINT: LD50 VALUE: 220 mg/kg REFERENCE SOURCE: PATTY (4th, 1994)

acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Calculated based on rabbit LD50 values: 128mg/kg, 170mg/kg and 324mg/kg (PATTY 4th, 1994). The calculation value was lower than lowest value, and the lowest value of 128mg/kg was adopted. Thus it was set as Category 2.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Rat LC50 values in 30 minute exposure are 600ppm (4-hour equivalent: 0.607mg/L) and 1500ppm (4-hour equivalent: 1.517mg/L) (ACGIH 7th, 2001, PATTY 4th, 1994). But it was classified based on 100ppm (equivalent 0.286mg/L): rat lethal concentration for 4 hour exposure (ACGIH 7th, 2001). 100 ppm indicates steam with almost no mist from the vapor pressure, and it was classified as Category 1 by the ppm concentration standard.

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was set as Category 2 from description that it was skin irritation as effect of the humans (IARC 63 (1995)), and description that severe irritation was admitted in the test applied to the skin of the rabbit (HSDB (2005)).

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: We classified it as Category 2A based on the description that the eyes of the rabbits were stimulated seriously (PATTY (4th, 1994)), and on the description that it had the ocular irritational property (IARC 63 (1995)).

respiratory_skin_sensitizer.classification: Respiratory sensitization: Classification not possible; Skin sensitization: Category1
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.hazard_statement: (Respiratory sensitization)-; (Skin sensitization)May cause allergic skin reaction
respiratory_skin_sensitizer.rationale: Respiratory organ: No data. Skin: Since IARC 63 (1995) and HSDB (2005) had respectively description of the cases which indicated sensitizing property, we classified it to be Category 1.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.hazard_statement: May cause genetic defects (state route of exposure if it is conclusively proven that no other routes of exposure cause the hazard)
germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since there is a positive result by the chromosome aberration test with the mouse spermatogonium using a germ cell, which is an in vivo mutagenicity test (IARC 63, 1995), it is set as Category 1B.

carcinogenicity.hazard_statement: Suspected of causing cancer (state route of exposure if it is conclusively proven that no other routes of exposure cause the hazard)
carcinogenicity.rationale: It was classified into a group 3 (IARC 63, 1995) in IARC and C (IRIS, 2005) in EPA in 1991. But it was classified into A3 in ACGIH (ACGIH 7th, 2001). So it was considered as Category 2 according to ACGIH which is latest assessment document.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause respiratory irritation or may cause drowsiness and dizziness (respiratory tract irritation)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: From description in ACGIH (7th, 2001) and IARC 63 (1995) that an upper respiratory tracts is strongly stimulated as affect on humans, and from description that decreased respiratory rate was seen in low concentrations in the inhalation exposure test using a mouse. So it was set as Category 3 (respiratory irritant).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organs/systemic toxicity following repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the description that significant toxicities was not observed in the 13-week oral study using the rat and mouse (IARC 63 (1995)), we classified it as Out Of Category.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 96-hour LC50=0.072mg/L of fishes (Oryzias latipes) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals, 2002).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 1, since acute toxicity was Category 1, and rapid degradability is unknown, though supposed less bioaccumulative (log Kow=0.6(PHYSPROP Database, 2005)).
